intro: Oenothera arizonica, commonly known as Arizona evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Oenothera arizonica is known for its ability to thrive in full sun and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
